channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Media companies thought late night TV was irrelevant. Kimmel proved them wrong
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel's return to airwaves might just point the way forward for late night TV to prove its relevance to American audiences — and to itself.

item.title: In a major milestone, Hamas releases final group of living Israeli hostages
item.description: The release by Hamas of living Israeli hostages began an expected swap of hostages for prisoners. In turn, Israel will be releasing nearly 2,000 Pales...

item.title: She was about to drop out of college, but then her professor stepped in
item.description: Midway through her first semester of college, Silvana Clark realized she didn't have enough money to finish the year. Then, her drama professor steppe...

item.title: Pastors and staff from underground church are arrested in China
item.description: China has in recent years arrested and detained Christian leaders of underground churches, who are not registered with the government and under its co...

item.title: Amid shutdown, Trump administration guts department overseeing special education
item.description: Multiple sources tell NPR that, as part of the Trump administration's latest reduction-in-force, the U.S. Department of Education has gutted the offic...

item.title: Madagascar presidency says attempt to seize power under way
item.description: An army unit claimed it had taken over leadership of the military command and was now in control of all the armed forces.

item.title: Trump says 'war is over' in Gaza as he flies to Israel for release of hostages
item.description: The US president tells reporters on board Air Force One the ceasefire "is going to hold".

item.title: Alaska hit by severe flooding that carries away homes
item.description: Alaska State Troopers said it received reports of "at least eight homes being pushed from their foundations."

item.title: Arthur M. Blank Family Foundation donating $50 million to historically Black Atlanta colleges
item.description: The Arthur M. Blank Family Foundation is donating $50 million to Atlanta’s historically Black colleges and universities.

item.title: Trump says he may send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine wants long-range missiles to hit back at Russia - and Donald Trump says he may send Tomahawks.

item.title: China accuses US of 'double standards' over tariff threat
item.description: Beijing says it could introduce "countermeasures" if the US President imposes an an additional 100% tariff on Chinese imports.

item.title: Sikh man with tumour held by US immigration denied medical care - family
item.description: Paramjit Singh, an Indian passport holder, has lived in the US on a green card since 1994.

item.title: Drug-resistant superbugs' spread surging, World Health Organization warns

item.title: Trump to speak as last living hostages return to Israel from Gaza
item.description: President Trump is to address Israeli lawmakers after Hamas handed over the final 13 living hostages under the Gaza peace deal brokered by the U.S. le...

item.title: 10/12: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Israel prepares for return of last Gaza hostages; Reflecting on Oct. 7, 2 years of Gaza war with Israeli hostages set to come home

item.title: New Jersey declares emergency as nor’easter approaches, while Alaska flooding carries away homes
Shooting at packed South Carolina bar kills 4 and injures at least 20 others
